The Central Palace's Pole Starâ€”its single bright starâ€”is where Taiyi permanently resides. Beside it, three stars represent the Three Dukes, or sometimes called the imperial heirs. Behind them, four curved stars: the final large star is the chief consort, the other three are attendants of the rear palace. Surrounding them, twelve guardian stars serve as feudal ministers. All together are called the Purple Palace.

In the front row, three stars at the Dipper's mouth follow the northern end of the Dui trigram, appearing and disappearing intermittently. They are called Yin Virtue, or sometimes Tianyi. To the left of the Purple Palace, three stars are called Heaven's Spear; to the right, five stars are called Heaven's Club; behind them, six stars cross the Milky Way to reach the Encampment Chamber, called the Pavilion Road.

The seven stars of the Northern Dipper are what is meant by: "Xuan Ji Yu Heng align the seven celestial bodies." The ladle carries the Dragon's horn, the balance presses on the Southern Dipper, the handle pillows Orion's head. The ladle is used for establishing direction at dusk. The ladle points from China southwestward. The balance is used for establishing direction at midnight. The balance points to the central states between the Yellow River and Ji River. The handle is used for establishing direction at dawn. The handle points to the northeast beyond the Tai and Dai mountains. The Dipper serves as the Emperor's carriage, moving at the center and overseeing the four directions. It divides yin and yang, establishes the four seasons, balances the five phases, shifts the measures, and determines all recordsâ€”all are tied to the Dipper.

The six stars worn by the Dipper handle like a crown form the Wen Chang Palace: the first is the Senior General, second the Junior General, third the Noble Chancellor, fourth the Controller of Fate, fifth the Controller of the Center, sixth the Controller of Salaries. Within the Dipper handle lies the noble person's prison. Below the handle, six stars paired in opposition are called the Three Neng. When the Three Neng are evenly colored, ruler and ministers are harmonious. When uneven, they become perverse and contrary. When the auxiliary stars are bright and close, auxiliary ministers are intimate and strong. When distant and dim, they are estranged and weak.

At the ladle's end are two stars: the inner one is the spear, Zhaoyao. The outer one is the shield, Tianfeng. There are fifteen stars in a curved circle belonging to the ladle, called the lowly person's prison. When the central star of the prison is solid, there are many prisoners; when empty, they are released.

When Tianyi, Spear, Club, Spear, and Shield shake and move, and the horns grow large, armies rise.

The Eastern Palace Azure Dragon consists of Fang and Xin. Xin forms the Bright Hall; its large star is the Heaven King, with the front and back stars as his attendants. They should not be straightâ€”if straight, the Heaven King loses his plans. Fang serves as the storehouse, called Heaven's Driver. Its yin side forms the right trace horse. Beside it are two stars called the Collar. The northern star is called the Fan. Twelve curved stars to the northeast form the Banner. Four stars in the banner's center form the Heavenly Market. The middle six stars are called the Market Tower. When the market's central stars are numerous, it is prosperous. When empty, it is depleted. The numerous stars south of Fang are called the Cavalry Official.

The left horn is Li. The right horn is the General. The large horn forms the Heaven King's imperial court. On each side are three stars, hooked like tripod feet, called Sheti. Sheti points straight where the Dipper ladle indicates, establishing the seasonal divisions. Hence the name "Sheti Ge." Kang forms the sparse temple and governs illness. Its two large stars, north and south, are called the South Gate. Di forms heaven's root and governs epidemics.

Wei represents the nine sons, called ruler and minister. When expelled and distant, they are not harmonious. Ji represents the proud guest, called mouth and tongue.

When fire offends and guards the horns, there will be battle. Fang and Xin are hated by kings.

The Southern Palace Vermilion Bird consists of Quan and Heng. Heng and Taiwei form the court of the three lights. The twelve guardian stars are feudal ministers: west, the general; east, the chancellor; south, four stars that execute the law; center, the main gate; on the gate's left and right, the wing gates. Six stars inside the gate represent the feudal lords. Five stars within these are the seats of the five emperors. Fifteen stars gathered behind, luxuriant, called the attendant positions. Beside them, one large star is the general's position. When the moon and five planets enter in orderly fashion along their tracks, they oversee their exits and guard positionsâ€”what the Son of Heaven punishes. When they enter in contrary fashion, not following their tracks, their determinations are based on what they offend. When they sit in the center and form shapes, all ministers below follow in plotting. Metal and fire are especially severe. West of the court barrier are five Sui stars, called Shaowei, representing scholar officials. Quan is Xuanyuan. Xuanyuan forms the yellow dragon's body. The front large star is the image of the female ruler. The small stars beside it are the driver and rear palace attendants. When the moon and five planets guard or offend, divine as with Heng.

Dongjing governs water affairs. Its western curved stars are called Yue. North of Yue is the North River. South is the South River. Between the two rivers and the Heavenly Gate are the passes and bridges. Yu Gui governs ghost shrine affairs. The central white one serves as hostage. When fire guards the north and south rivers, armies rise and grain fails. Thus virtue completes at Heng, observation completes at Kuang, wounds complete at Yue, calamities complete at Jing, executions complete at the hostage.

Liu serves as the bird spout and governs wood and grass. Seven Stars form the neck and serve as the round official. It governs urgent affairs. Zhang and Su serve as the kitchen and govern banquet guests. Yi forms the feathers and governs distant guests.

Zhen forms the carriage and governs wind. Beside it is one small star called Changshaâ€”the stars should not be bright. If bright and equal to four stars, or if five stars enter Zhen's midst, great armies will arise. The numerous stars south of Zhen are called the Heavenly Storehouse Tower. The storehouse contains five chariots. If the chariot stars' horns increase in number, or are incomplete, there will be no place for chariots and horses.

The Western Palace Xianchi is called the Heavenly Five Kuang. The Five Kuang are the chariot lodges of the five emperors. When fire enters, drought occurs. When metal enters, warfare. Water brings floods. In the middle are three pillars. When the pillars are incomplete, armies rise.

Kui is called Fengshi and governs ditches and drains. Lou governs the gathering of crowds. Wei serves as the Heavenly Granary. The numerous stars to its south are called the storehouse accumulations.

Mao is called the mane head, a barbarian star, governing assemblies in white clothing. Bi is called the sparse vehicle and governs border troops and hunting. The small star beside its large star forms the attached ear. When the attached ear shakes and moves, slanderous chaotic ministers are at the side. Between Mao and Bi lies the Heavenly Street. Its yin side represents the yin states. Its yang side represents the yang states.

Shen forms the White Tiger. Three stars in a straight line form the balance stone. Below are three stars of the Dui trigram, called Punishment, governing the cutting of weeds. The outer four stars are the left and right shoulders and thighs. Three small stars placed at the corners are called Zixi, forming the tiger's head and governing guard and travel affairs. Four stars to its south are called the Heavenly Toilet. One star below the toilet is called the Heavenly Arrow. When the arrow is yellow, it is auspicious. When blue, white, or black, it is inauspicious. To its west are nine curved stars spread in three places: first called Heaven Flag, second called Heaven Garden, third called Nine Roam. To its east is a large star called Wolf. When the Wolf's horns change color, there are many bandits and thieves. Below are four stars called Arc, facing the Wolf. Compared to earth, there is a large star beside Wolf called the South Pole Old Man. When the Old Man appears, governance is peaceful. When he does not appear, armies rise. He is constantly observed at the south suburb during the autumn equinox.

The Northern Palace Black Tortoise consists of Xu and Wei. Wei forms the covering house. Xu governs weeping and crying affairs.

Numerous stars to its south are called the Feather Forest Heavenly Army. West of the army is the rampart, or called Yue. Beside it is one large star called North Fall. When North Fall is faint or lost, the army stars move and their horns become sparser. When the five planets offend North Fall and enter the army, armies rise. Fire, metal, and water are especially severe: fire brings army worries. Water brings flood calamities. Wood and earth bring army auspiciousness. Six stars east of Wei, paired in opposition, are called Sikong.

Camp Room forms the pure temple, called Li Palace and Pavilion Way. Four stars in the middle of the Milky Way are called Heaven Driver. One star beside it is called Wang Liang. Wang Liang whips his horses, filling the fields with chariots and cavalry. Beside them are eight stars crossing the Milky Way, called Heaven Kuang. Beside Heaven Kuang is the Jiang star. When the Jiang star moves, people ford the waters.

Observe the firm qi to position Yinghuo. It is called Southern Fire, governs summer, called Bing and Ding. When ritual is lost, punishment emerges from Yinghuoâ€”Yinghuo losing its proper course. When it emerges, there are troops; when it enters, troops scatter. Its lodgings determine the fate of states. Yinghuo represents violent chaos, remnant harm, illness, mourning, famine, warfare. When contrary to the way by two lodgings or more and dwells there, in three months there is calamity, in five months receives troops, in seven months loses half its land, in nine months loses most of its land. Because it enters and exits together with it, the state's sacrifices are extinguished. When it dwells there, calamity returnsâ€”even if great it becomes small. If it stays long and arrives, when small it becomes great instead. Its south brings husband mourning, north brings wife mourning. If horns move and circle around it, or suddenly front then back, left and right, the calamity grows greater. When it fights with other stars and their lights reach each other, it becomes harmful. When they do not reach each other, there is no harm. When all five planets follow and gather in one lodging, the state below can bring all under heaven through ritual.

In Qin Shi Huang's time, in fifteen years comets appeared four times, the longest eighty days, sometimes spanning across heaven. After this Qin used troops to extinguish the six kings, united China, expelled the four barbarians outside, dead people like chaotic hemp, because of this Zhang and Chu arose together, within thirty years troops mutually trampled upon, beyond counting. From Chi You until now, it has never been like this.

When Xiang Yu rescued Julu, Wang Shi flowed westward, Shandong then united with the feudal lords, west they pitted the Qin people, executing and slaughtering Xianyang.

When Han rose, five stars gathered at Dong Jing. During the siege of Pingcheng, the moon haloed Shen and Bi seven layers. When the various Lu made chaos, the sun eclipsed, the day turned dark. When Wu and Chu seven states rebelled contrary, a comet several zhang long, heaven dog passed over Liang fields; And when troops arose, hidden corpses and flowing blood were below it. In Yuanguang and Yuanshou, Chi You's flag appeared again, when long spanning half heaven. After this Jing Shi commanders went out in four directions, executing barbarian Yi for several decades, while attacking Hu especially severely. When Yue perished, Ying Huo guarded Dou; When Chaoxian was pulled out, star Fu at He Shu; When troops campaigned against Dayuan, star Fu at Zhao Yao: these are the great bright ones. As for the detailed small changes, they cannot all be spoken of. From this we see that there has never been a case where the omen did not appear first and the response follow after.

Since Han became heaven's reckoning, for stars it is Tang Du, for qi it is Wang Shuo, for divining years it is Wei Xian. Thus Gan and Shi's five star calendar method, only Ying Huo has contrary retrograde motion; Retrograde motion where it guards, and other stars' retrograde motion, sun and moon thin eclipses, all are used for divination.

ä½™è§€å²è¨˜ï¼Œè€ƒè¡Œäº‹ï¼Œç™¾å¹´ä¹‹ä¸­ï¼Œäº”æ˜Ÿç„¡å‡ºè€Œä¸åé€†è¡Œï¼Œåé€†è¡Œï¼Œå˜—ç››å¤§è€Œè®Šè‰²ï¼› æ—¥æœˆè–„è•ï¼Œè¡Œå—åŒ—æœ‰æ™‚ï¼šæ­¤å…¶å¤§åº¦ä¹Ÿã€‚ æ•…ç´«å®®ã€æˆ¿å¿ƒã€æ¬Šè¡¡ã€å’¸æ± ã€è™›å±åˆ—å®¿éƒ¨æ˜Ÿï¼Œæ­¤å¤©ä¹‹äº”å®˜åä½ä¹Ÿï¼Œç‚ºç¶“ï¼Œä¸ç§»å¾™ï¼Œå¤§å°æœ‰å·®ï¼Œé—Šç‹¹æœ‰å¸¸ã€‚ æ°´ã€ç«ã€é‡‘ã€æœ¨ã€å¡«æ˜Ÿï¼Œæ­¤äº”æ˜Ÿè€…ï¼Œå¤©ä¹‹äº”ä½ï¼Œç‚ºï¼»ç¶“ï¼½ç·¯ï¼Œè¦‹ä¼æœ‰æ™‚ï¼Œæ‰€éè¡Œè´ç¸®æœ‰åº¦ã€‚
I have observed the history records, examined the conduct of affairs, within a hundred years, the five stars never emerge without contrary retrograde motion, contrary retrograde motion often flourishes greatly and changes color; Sun and moon thin eclipses, their motion north and south has timing: this is their great measure. Thus Zi Gong, Fang Xin, Quan Heng, Xian Chi, Xu Wei column lodges department stars, these are heaven's five official seat positions, they are the constants, do not move or transfer, great and small have differences, broad and narrow have constants. Water, fire, metal, wood, Tian Xingâ€”these five stars are heaven's five assistants, for warp and weft, appearing and hiding have timing, where they pass their advance and retreat have measure.

æ—¥è®Šä¿®å¾·ï¼Œæœˆè®Šçœåˆ‘ï¼Œæ˜Ÿè®Šçµå’Œã€‚ å‡¡å¤©è®Šï¼Œéåº¦ä¹ƒå ã€‚ åœ‹å›å½Šå¤§ï¼Œæœ‰å¾·è€…æ˜Œï¼› ç¾½å°ï¼Œé£¾è©è€…äº¡ã€‚ å¤ªä¸Šä¿®å¾·ï¼Œå…¶æ¬¡ä¿®æ”¿ï¼Œå…¶æ¬¡ä¿®æ•‘ï¼Œå…¶æ¬¡ä¿®ç¦³ï¼Œæ­£ä¸‹ç„¡ä¹‹ã€‚ å¤«å¸¸æ˜Ÿä¹‹è®Šå¸Œè¦‹ï¼Œè€Œä¸‰å…‰ä¹‹å äºŸç”¨ã€‚ æ—¥æœˆæšˆé©ï¼Œé›²é¢¨ï¼Œæ­¤å¤©ä¹‹å®¢æ°£ï¼Œå…¶ç™¼è¦‹äº¦æœ‰å¤§é‹ã€‚ ç„¶å…¶èˆ‡æ”¿äº‹ä¿¯ä»°ï¼Œæœ€è¿‘ï¼ˆå¤§ï¼‰ï¼»å¤©ï¼½äººä¹‹ç¬¦ã€‚ æ­¤äº”è€…ï¼Œå¤©ä¹‹æ„Ÿå‹•ã€‚ ç‚ºå¤©æ•¸è€…ï¼Œå¿…é€šä¸‰äº”ã€‚ çµ‚å§‹å¤ä»Šï¼Œæ·±è§€æ™‚è®Šï¼Œå¯Ÿå…¶ç²¾ç²—ï¼Œå‰‡å¤©å®˜å‚™çŸ£ã€‚
Sun changes cultivate virtue, moon changes reduce punishments, stars change bind harmony. Generally for heaven changes, only when exceeding degree do we divine. State lords who are strong and great, those with virtue prosper; Feathers small, those who adorn with deception perish. The highest cultivate virtue, next cultivate governance, next cultivate rescue, next cultivate exorcism, the lowest have none. Changes in constant stars are rarely seen, but divination of the three lights is frequently used. Sun and moon halos meeting, clouds and windsâ€”these are heaven's guest qi, their appearances also have great fortune. However their relation with governance affairs in rising and falling, most closely approaches the sign between heaven and man. These five are heaven's movements. Those who reckon heaven's numbers must understand the three and five. From end to beginning, ancient to modern, deeply observe time changes, examine their essence and coarseness, then the heaven official is complete.

è’¼å¸è¡Œå¾·ï¼Œå¤©é–€ç‚ºä¹‹é–‹ã€‚ èµ¤å¸è¡Œå¾·ï¼Œå¤©ç‰¢ç‚ºä¹‹ç©ºã€‚ é»ƒå¸è¡Œå¾·ï¼Œå¤©å¤­ç‚ºä¹‹èµ·ã€‚ é¢¨å¾è¥¿åŒ—ä¾†ï¼Œå¿…ä»¥åºšã€è¾›ã€‚ ä¸€ç§‹ä¸­ï¼Œäº”è‡³ï¼Œå¤§èµ¦ï¼› ä¸‰è‡³ï¼Œå°èµ¦ã€‚ ç™½å¸è¡Œå¾·ï¼Œä»¥æ­£æœˆäºŒåæ—¥ã€äºŒåä¸€æ—¥ï¼Œæœˆæšˆåœï¼Œå¸¸å¤§èµ¦è¼‰ï¼Œè¬‚æœ‰å¤ªé™½ä¹Ÿã€‚ ä¸€æ›°ï¼šç™½å¸è¡Œå¾·ï¼Œç•¢ã€æ˜´ç‚ºä¹‹åœã€‚ åœä¸‰æš®ï¼Œå¾·ä¹ƒæˆï¼› ä¸ä¸‰æš®ï¼ŒåŠåœä¸åˆï¼Œå¾·ä¸æˆã€‚ äºŒæ›°ï¼šä»¥è¾°åœï¼Œä¸å‡ºå…¶æ—¬ã€‚ é»‘å¸è¡Œå¾·ï¼Œå¤©é—œç‚ºä¹‹å‹•ã€‚ å¤©è¡Œå¾·ï¼Œå¤©å­æ›´ç«‹å¹´ï¼› ä¸å¾·ï¼Œé¢¨é›¨ç ´çŸ³ã€‚ ä¸‰èƒ½ã€ä¸‰è¡¡è€…ï¼Œå¤©å»·ä¹Ÿã€‚ å®¢æ˜Ÿå‡ºå¤©å»·ï¼Œæœ‰å¥‡ä»¤ã€‚
When the Blue Emperor practices virtue, the heaven gate opens for it. When the Red Emperor practices virtue, the heaven prison empties for it. When the Yellow Emperor practices virtue, heaven's premature rises for it. When wind comes from northwest, it must be with Geng and Xin. Within one autumn, five arrivals bring great amnesty; Three arrivals bring small amnesty. When the White Emperor practices virtue, on first month twentieth and twenty-first days, moon halos surround, constantly great amnesty year, called having sun. One says: When the White Emperor practices virtue, Bi and Mao surround it. Surrounding for three evenings, virtue then completes; Not three evenings, and the surrounding does not combine, virtue does not complete. Two says: with Chen surrounding, does not go beyond its ten days. When the Black Emperor practices virtue, the heaven pass moves for it. When heaven practices virtue, the Son of Heaven changes and establishes the year; When not virtuous, wind and rain break stone. The three Neng and three Heng are the heaven court. When guest stars emerge in the heaven court, there are strange commands.
